caption:
I made a lot of potentially contentious decisions with this one, but I stand by the final product. I used cheaper liquors, because I felt like the nuances of high-quality ingredients would be lost against the heat. I also didn't double strain it. With all of the recent love for heavily fruited sour beers, I thought a little pulp and seed might lend a fun smoothie quality to the drink. 

'Mango Habanero Margarita'
2.0 oz white tequila
0.5 oz triple sec
1.0 oz lime juice
5 chunks of fresh mango
¼-½ habanero (depending how much heat you like)

Muddle mango and habanero. Add other ingredients and ice. Shake. Strain into a salted rim margarita glass. Garnish with mango (for eating) and a whole habanero (for aesthetics).

Thanks to @helaine109 for the fruity inspiration!

#mango #mangohabanero #Margarita #tequila #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad
First drink with the incredible grapefruit and lavender flavored vodka I got from @chakravodkas . This is a low ABV sipper, good and refreshing for the few hot days we have left this year. I wanted to garnish with a spring of lavender, but it just wasn't growing well this season. ...oh well, still a great drink!

'Helen's Soda'
2.0 oz grapefruit and lavender flavored vodka
1.0 oz lime juice
1.0 oz simple syrup
2.0 oz grapefruit juice
2 dashes lavender bitters

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a Collins glass. Top with club soda. Garnish with a lime wedge.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for the collaboration.

#cpcfs #lavender #grapefruit #vodka #newbottle #floral #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad
A couple years back, I found a great recipe for a "reverse amaro old fashioned" that I've loved. The other night I decided to try it with the dark rum I got from @tikiloversrum instead of whiskey, and it came out really well! I highly recommend this one if you like a bitter sipper with sugary notes and a paradoxical disposition.

'Reverse Amaro Rum Fashion'
2.0 oz @amaromontenegro_us
1.0 oz @tikiloversrum dark rum
1 bar spoon demerara syrup
2 dashes old-fashioned bitters

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with maraschino cherries.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration.

#rum #agedrum #amaro #bitter #oldfashioned #cptlr @worldwide_libations #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad
I'm excited for this first drink made with the dark rum from @tikiloversrum . This cocktail was inspired by a friend who said it's a common order at the bar where she works. Thanks, Ash.

'Ashley's Drink'
2.0 oz dark rum
1.0 oz peach schnapps
2.0 oz pineapple juice
2.0 oz orange juice 
0.5 oz grenadine

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a Collins glass with fresh ice. Garnish with a little umbrella and maraschino cherries.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration.

#rum #agedrum #pineapplejuice #tropical #grenadine #cptlr @worldwide_libations #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

One of my Danish friends once said, "Joe, it seems like you actually like aquavit instead of just tolerate it like all the rest of us." ....well, @friisdk93 , you're right. And every once in a while, I like to challenge myself and see if I can mix with it. This one came out pretty well! The caraway and the nuttiness complement each other well against the corn base of the bourbon.

'Rune's Surprise'
3.0 oz bourbon
1.0 oz @linieaquavit_official
0.5 oz hazelnut liqueur
0.5 oz Amaretto

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with maraschino cherries.

#oldfashioned #aquavit #hazelnut #bourbon #whiskey #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad

How does a chocolate margarita sound? Because it tastes delicious! A perfect dessert treat for these hot summer days. Thanks to @maraska_zadar for this bottle of chocolate liqueur which really rounds out this drink.

'Chocolate Margarita'
2.0 oz tequila (be sure to use something like a nice reposado)
0.5 oz mezcal
1.0 oz cointreau
1.0 oz Maraska Nocelino Chocolate
2.0 oz lime juice 

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a margarita glass with a salted rim. Garnish with a lime wedge and square of chocolate.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour
for this collaboration!

#chocolate #maraschino #cpmch #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

Yesterday, a colleague told me about a drink made with green chartreuse. He said there was an ad that ran, proclaiming how delicious 'Swampwater' was. Not being the biggest fan of chartreuse, I asked, "and it's good?" To which he responded, "well, I'm a sucker for a good campaign." Later on, Jeff found me the recipe and I gave it a whirl. Surprisingly, it was alright. I'm not sure it'll become a staple for me, but I'm glad I tried it. (Swipe to see the ad)

'Swampwater'
1.5 oz green chartreuse
6.0 oz pineapple juice
¼ lime

Add ingredients over ice (I muddled the lime, though the instructions were vague on this part). Shake. Strain into a Mason jar glass with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wedge.

#newexperiences #greenchartreuse #swampwater #pineapplejuice #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

Here's another use for the incredible Nocelino Chocolate Liqueur I got from @maraska_zadar . This was kinda a no-brainer. What goes better with chocolate than raspberry and cream?

'Chocolate Raspberry Truffle'
2.0 oz vodka
1.0 oz chocolate liqueur
0.5 oz raspberry schnapps
2.0 oz cream

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a square of extra dark chocolate.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for the collaboration!

#chocolate #truffle #raspberry #cpmch @worldwide_libations #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

First cocktail with this amazing chocolate liqueur from @maraska_zadar is a favorite of mine. I love 'Chocolate Old Fashioneds' with brandy. They just hit every note, in my opinion. Using the liqueur instead of a syrup adds fantastic depth and flavor.

'Brandy Chocolate Old Fashioned'
2.0 oz brandy
1.0 oz Nocelino Chocolate 
3 dashes Aztec chocolate bitters

Add ingredients over ice. Give a long stir. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with maraschino cherries.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration!

#chocolatebitters #oldfashioned #chocolate #brandy #maraschino #cpmch @worldwide_libations #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

Last night, a friend of mine ordered a 'Harvey Wallbanger' at my bar. I'd kinda forgotten about this drink, but decided to use it as a base and make this riff. It's like if a 'Harvey Wallbanger' and a 'Mimosa' had a baby...

'Harvey Mim'
2.0 oz vodka
3.0 oz orange juice 
1.0 oz lime juice
0.75 oz anisette
1.0 oz prosecco

Add ingredients (except prosecco) over ice. Shake. Top with prosecco. Garnish with a lime twist.

#harveywallbanger #mimosa #vodka #classiccocktails #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

This drink just kinda took on a life of its own. The golden Falernum from @thebittertruthcompany is so flavorful, I wanted to exhibit those flavors against a strong bitter background. The herbal notes from the gin was something I'm not used to combining with Falernum, but they work well together.

'Bitter Herbs'
2.0 oz gin
1.0 oz The Bitter Truth Golden Falernum
0.75 oz lemon juice
0.5 oz amaro
2 dashes orange bitters 

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a coup glass. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

Thank you to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration!

#cpbtc #happyaccidents #newflavors #gin #falernum #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad
Really excited to share a drink made with @dentedbrickdistillery Disco-Nut coconut rum for pride month. This is a simple drink, but it's fun, fruity, topical, and glitters! This rum is absolutely fantastic and a portion of the proceeds go to support @utahpridecenter 

'Glitter Love'
2.0 oz Disco-nut
1.0 oz cointreau
2 dashes orange bitters

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with an orange twist.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration!

#rum #manhatten #orange #loveislove #cpdbd #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #pride #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

I made my mom a strawberry margarita for Mother's Day, and I thought I would share it with all of you. She likes the sweet/savory combination of rimming with salt, and I have to say, I agree!

'Frozen Strawberry Margarita'
2.0 oz reposado tequila
1.0 oz @cointreau 
2.5 oz homemade strawberry syrup
2.0 oz lime juice
~1 cup frozen strawberries

Add ingredients to a blender. Blend. Pour into a margarita glass, rimmed with salt. Garnish with a fresh strawberry.

#sweetandsalty #Margarita #tequila #strawberrymargarita #frozen #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

It's race day again! The Kentucky Derby has a well-defined cocktail to represent it, but the Preakness Stakes has a little more wiggle room. It's agreed that the cocktail is a 'Black Eyed Susan', but the recipe for this drink seems a little more varied. After seeing what others are doing, here's my version.

'Black Eyed Susan'
1.5 oz vodka
1.5 oz rum
0.5 oz peach schnapps
0.5 oz triple sec
2.0 oz orange juice
2.0 oz pineapple juice

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a high ball. Garnish with an orange slice and maraschino cherry.

#blackeyedsusan #vodka #pineapplejuice #rum #horseracing #preakness #triplecrown #trysomethingnew #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad
I've been experimenting with @aperolusa lately for a class I'm leading at the end of the month. I thought it might go nicely with the Golden Falernum that I got from @thebittertruthcompany and it made this wonderful and refreshing sipper.

'Red Sipper'
2.0 oz vodka
1.0 oz Golden Falernum
0.5 oz Aperol
0.5 oz lemon juice 
0.5 oz simple syrup
2 dashes angostarga bitters 

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with lemon wedge.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration!

#vodka #mydrink #original #trysomethingnew #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram #cpbtc

Cheers to the Run for the Roses! It would be too simple to do a mint julep, so I went with my version of a 'Kentucky Mule'

'JP's Kentucky Mule'
3.0 oz @woodfordreserve 
0.75 oz ginger syrup
3.0 oz lime juice
0.75 oz @grandmarnierofficial 

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a julep mug. Top with club soda. Garnish with a rose.

#kentuckyderby #julep #kentuckymule #roses #bourbon #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

Yes, I know I should have added a salt rim to this, but I couldn't find my salt or my rimmer, so I guess, much like Charles de Lorencez, I'm a loser this Cinco de Mayo, but have a happy celebration anyway!

'Raspberry Margarita'
2.0 oz reposado tequila
2.0 oz fresh squeezed lime juice
1.0 oz raspberry liqueur
1.0 oz agave nectar
5 drops saline solution

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a (hopefully salt rimmed) margarita glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.

#RaspberryLime #Margarita #cincodemayo #tequila #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

May the Fourth be with you! To celebrate Star Wars Day, I decided to use my Grogu tiki mug. Since it was a gift from my sister, I purposely made a drink I know she would enjoy. Hope to be drinking them with her soon!

'Tiki Star Wars'
2.0 oz coconut rum
3.0 oz pineapple juice
0.75 oz orgeat
0.5 oz butterscotch schnapps 

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a themed tiki mug. Garnish with maraschino cherries and a tiny umbrella.

#maythefourth #starwarsday #toosweetforme #rum #tikidrinks #pineapple #sugary #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad
So I had an idea for a cocktail that involved a lot of cinnamon. When I went to my bar, I couldn't find any of my cinnamon ingredients, so I had to pivot to the next most obvious flavor: anis! The Golden Falernum from @thebittertruthcompany works really well in this drink and provides a fun spicy juxtaposition to the refreshing anis.

'Oops No Cinnamon'
2.0 oz tequila
1.0 oz Golden Falernum
0.75 oz anisette
0.5 oz demerara syrup
1 bar spoon absinthe

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain. Garnish with star anis.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration.

#HappyAccidents #Anis #absinthe #originaldrink #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram #cpbtc

Sometimes it's boring to mix for friends and family. A lot of people have certain go-to drinks or ingredients, so you just keep making more of the same. I decided to start to broaden my mom's horizons. She's not a whiskey drinker, so I made her a whiskey drink. She likes coffee and nutty flavors, and I figured a rich spirit like bourbon would do well to support those. ....I was right!

'Lisa's Surprise'
2.0 oz bourbon
1.5 oz coffee liqueur
0.5 oz amaretto
0.5 oz hazelnut liqueur

Add ingredients over ice. Give it a long stir. Strain into rocks glass. Float three dashes of toasted almond bitters. Garnish with maraschino cherries.

#feebrothers #whiskey #coffeeliqueur #nutty #bourbon #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad
Sometimes, you wander down to your basement bar with nothing in mind and start mixing. I knew I wanted to use the fantastic falernum from @bgreynolds that I got, and I wanted to move away from classic tiki drinks. These syrups really have incredible balance and shouldn't be pigeonholed. What I ended up making was a complex and delicious drink for a Tuesday night.

'Complex and Delicious Tuesday Night'
2.0 oz gin
1.0 oz @cointreau
0.75 oz falernum
1 bar spoon @luxardoofficial

Add ingredients over ice. Give a hearty stir. Strain into coup glass. Garnish with orange twist.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for the collaboration!

#gin #falernum #complex #happyaccident #originaldrink #mydrink #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram #cpbgr

#ad
My mom helped me come up with this one, so I have to give her a shout-out. I wanted to use the incredible @bgreynolds Lush Grenadine, but I didn't want to make just "another tequila sunrise," so I changed it up and even included some of their outstanding passion fruit syrup! Mom named it:

'Waiting for Spring'
4.0 oz orange juice
3.0 oz coconut rum
0.75 oz passion fruit syrup
0.75 oz grenadine

Add ingredients, sans grenadine, over ice. Shake. Strain into a hurricane glass. Float grenadine down the side to layer. Garnish with an orange slice and little umbrella.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for the collaboration.

#Originaldrink #cpbgr #rum #tropicalcocktails #grenadine #tequilasunrise #passionfruit #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram #cpbgr

#ad
The first cocktail I made with my new syrups from @bgreynolds was a no-brainer. I can easily say that the 'Mai Tai' is my favorite tropical drink. Citrus, nuts, sweet, sour, it's beautiful, and the orgeat syrup here is outstanding! Of course, I had to change things up a little to be creative, so I used some coconut rum, and it came out great!

'Coconut Mai Tai'
2.0 oz white rum
1.0 oz orgeat syrup
0.5 oz triple sec
0.5 oz lime juice
0.5 oz lemon juice

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into rocks glass. Top with coconut rum and aged rum. Garnish with a lime wedge.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for the collaboration.

#Tiki #orgeat #MaiTai #coconut #variations #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram #cpbgr

#ad 
I'm so excited to be working with @bgreynolds and their incredible syrups. I got this sample pack and I'm blown away by the quality. There are too many cocktail syrups out there that are thick, sugary, and flavorless. These have incredible balance, and lend the appropriate support to a drink without being overpowering. I can't wait to show you what I've made with them!

As always, thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration.

#tikidrinks #cocktailsyrups #passionfruit #orgeat #grenadine #falernum #tropical Original #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

This is in NO way an add or paid post.

I have enough friends with Chicago ties that I've been forced to taste @jeppsonsmalort on more than one occasion, and I finally decided to try to turn it into a cocktail. Honestly, I think a 'Naked and Famous' rif makes good use of this very polarizing liqueur.

'Malört and Famous'
0.75 oz Malört
0.75 oz mezcal
0.75 oz lime juice
1.5 oz aperol
0.75 oz demerara syrup

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain. Garnish with lime wedge.

#ChallengeAccepted #NakedAndFamous #chicago #Creative #MyDrink #Original #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad
Coconut Rum is easy enough to mix into tiki, tropical, and tangy drinks, but what happens when you use it in a Manhattan? ....well, if you're using Disco-nut by @dentedbrickdistillery you get a very tasty cocktail!

'Discohattan'
3.0 oz Disco-nut
1.0 oz dry vermouth
1.0 oz creme de cassis
2 dashes orange bitters 

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain. Garnish with cherries.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration!

#manhattandrink #whiskeysubstitute #coconutrum #rum #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram #cpdbd

#ad
What does one do with cucumber bitters?? .... apparently, mix them with elderflower. This seems to be a popular combination, and after mixing up this drink, I can see why! The cucumber flavor from these bitters by @thebittertruthcompany are absolutely outstanding. Also now I don't need a bunch of cucumbers going bad in the fridge on the off chance I want them in a cocktail.

'Elderflower Cucumber Daiquiri'
2.0 oz white rum
1.0 oz elderflower liqueur
0.75 oz lime juice
4 dashes cucumber bitters

Add ingredients, sans bitters, over ice. Shake. Strain into a glass. Add bitters and garnish with a lime twist.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration!

#cucumber #daiquiri #elderflower #rum #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad

Here's bitters number 2 from @thebittertruthcompany . This is their peach bitters which lends a fun fruity balance to the spicy rye and ginger I used in this drink. If there's one thing I've learned during cocktail making, it's that ginger and peach work well together. Try it out!

'Peachy Keen'
3.0 oz rye whiskey
0.5 oz demerara syrup
5 dashes peach bitters

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain into a rocks glass. Fill with ginger ale. Garnish with maraschino cherries.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for the collaboration.

#whiskey #rye #peach #bitters #oldfashioned #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

A while back, I saved a recipe by @coventrycocktails for banana oleo syrup. I finally got around to making it and was not disappointed! I know most people expect a 'Banana Daiquiri' to be a blended drink with frozen bananas, but this is more reminiscent of a traditional 'Daiquiri' and it is amazing!

'Banana Daiquiri'
2.0 oz spiced rum
1.0 oz banana oleo syrup
0.75 oz lime juice
0.5 oz banana liqueur

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into glass. Garnish with banana slices.

#banana #daiquiri #traditional #rum #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad

Alright, two hot toddies in a row, sorry. But I made this delightful 0 ABV drink when I had my cold and was sick of tea. It's great to warm you up after shoveling or sooth your sore throat. Also, I got to use one of the amazing bitters from @thebittertruthcompany .

'Raspberry Chocolate Soother'
1 Tbsp molasses
1 bar spoon raspberry extract
5 dashes chocolate bitters

Add ingredients to a mug. Fill with hot water. Stir. Garnish with a square of chocolate.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for this collaboration.

#0abv #mocktails #raspberrychocolate #bitters #molasses #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

I have been quite ill for the past two weeks. First with norovirus, then rhinovirus. As I was griping about my sore throat, a nurse friend gave me this recipe for a cocktail (so it must be healthy, right?)

'I Heard You Were Sick'
2.0 oz Canadian whiskey
⅛ oz lemon juice
1 Tbsp honey
5 oz hot water

Combine ingredients in an Irish coffee mug and stir. Garnish with an additional lemon wedge. Turn on your humidifier, sit back in your comfy chair, binge watch TV, and get better.

#illness #sick #homeremedy #whiskey #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

I was going to complain about how cold it is, but Upstate NY seems to be experiencing False Spring. ....still, I imagine there aren't too many people at the beach, so this drink will hopefully get us excited for warmer weather. I decided to use pineapple rum as the base spirit and was quite impressed!

'Prickly Sex on the Beach'
2.0 oz pineapple rum
0.75 oz peach schnapps
2.0 oz fresh-squeezed orange juice
2.0 oz cranberry grape juice

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a hurricane glass. Garnish with cherries, orange twist, and a tiny umbrella.

#tiki #rum #sexonthebech #peach #tinyumbrella #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

Believe it or not, this drink started with me saying, "I wonder how a whisky-based Mai Tai would taste." ....it quickly turned into something else entirely.

'Not A Whisky-based Mai Tai'
3.0 oz Canadian whiskey
0.75 oz lemon juice
1.0 oz orgeat syrup 
1.0 oz peach schnapps 

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

#happyaccident #whisky #MaiTai #tiki #peach #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

I think my parents are starting to figure out that, if they leave fruit around, it will end up in a cocktail. Today's drink came from the kiwis dad bought.

'Who Stole My Kiwi'
2.0 oz white rum
1.0 oz melon liqueur 
1.0 oz rock candy syrup
1.0 oz fresh squeezed lemon juice
1 peeled kiwi

Muddle kiwi. Add other ingredients and ice. Shake. Strain into a hurricane glass. Garnish with a slice of kiwi.

#kiwi #rum #melonliqueur #tikicocktails #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

My mom said, "Joe, make me something with coconut rum," so I tossed this together.

'Coconut Nut Daiquiri'
2.0 oz coconut rum
1.0 oz orgeat syrup
1.0 oz fresh squeezed lime juice

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a lime twist and coconut cashew cluster (yes, I know orgeat is almond, but they work well together)

#coconut #rum #daiquiri #nutty #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

So, my parents apparently really like clementines. They're always around, so I figured I'd put them into a drink!

'Clementine Bourbon Sour'
3.0 oz bourbon
1.0 oz simple syrup
0.5 oz aperol 
2 juiced clementines
3 dashes Fee Foam

Add ingredients over ice. Shake long and hard. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with a clementine segment.

#bourbon #whisky #clementine #feebrothers

Here's a nice bright and refreshing drink that came from just messing around at the bar. I found a bottle of grapefruit soda while at the grocery store and decided to try to incorporate it. I think it came out well!

'Lime and Grapefruit Drink'
2.0 oz gin
0.75 oz aperol
1.0 oz fresh lime juice
0.5 oz simple syrup

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a coup glass. Add a splash of grapefruit soda. Garnish with a lime twist.

Sometimes, in lab, we make life-changing pharmaceuticals. Sometimes, we come up with cocktail recipes. Shout-out to @anthonytomaine for helping conceive the 'Bloody Napoleon'. We worked hard on this, so I hope you enjoy. It's cognac based (🇫🇷), sweetened with Creole syrup (🇫🇷 influenced), and has a float of Chartreuse (🇫🇷). I felt Tabasco was too far from the target ethnicity, so I used the Hellfire Tincture from @smugglerscovesf to bring the heat and honor this fiery world leader. The sidecar is frozen vodka, reminiscent of Russia in the winter. I kept some of the other seasonings the same because I still wanted the feel of a classic "bloody" drink. All-in-all, I was very pleased!

2.0 oz cognac
2.0 oz tomato juice
1.0 oz Creole syrup
0.5 oz lime juice
4 dashes Hellfire Tincture
2 dashes Worcestershire sauce
¼ bar spoon of horseradish
Few hearty grinds of salt and pepper

Rim a glass with Creole seasoning. Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain over fresh ice. Float Chartreuse on top. Garnish with a sword (of course), celery, and olives. Serve with a sidecar of frozen vodka.

#cognac #french #nepoleon #bloody #originaldrink #mydrink #creole #culture #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers #skål #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

Onion powder? Now that's not something you tend to see in a drink. Shout-out to my man @chefseph_catering for hooking me up with this creole seasoning blend. I made a big batch of seasoning and then made a syrup out of it. ....what did it do with said syrup? .... Stay tuned.

Seasoning:
2 tbsp paprika
2 tbsp garlic powder
2 tbsp oregano
1 tbsp salt
1 tbsp onion powder
2 tsp black pepper
2 tsp cayenne

Mix ingredients thoroughly.

Syrup:
1 C water
2 C sugar
1 tsp creole seasoning

Bring water to boil. Add sugar and seasoning. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool. Filter through a fine mesh strainer. Dunno how long it keeps, I just made it.

You know I'm getting back into the mixology groove when I have random jars sitting around making syrups and the like. This one here is a citrus cordial. I got the recipe from @selmasaur and I'm super excited to give it a try.

In her book "Spirit of the North", Selma writes:
1 C freshly-squeezed lemon juice
1 C freshly-squeezed orange juice
1 C superfine sugar

Mix well until sugar is completely dissolved, than add the peels of the oranges and lemons used for juicing. Let sit overnight at a minimum, with the peels of the oranges and lemons, but up to 2 days for the perfect yield. Strain before use.

So @barreloftiki is doing this event reminiscent of the use of secret ingredients in tiki drinks. I had to try it out. My secret ingredient is actually the spirit. It's a delicate combination of 3 different vodkas. One is made from wheat, one is made from sweet potatoes, one is made from apples. One adds spice, one adds body, one adds sweetness. An Investigation of Whiskey Sour Foam

Dr. J. A. Izzo, PhD

INTRODUCTION.  Observations and conversations with @theacademydrinks and @karenvanvloten raised the question, "what factor has a larger effect on the amount of foam for a sour-type drink?" The two schools of thought are: (1) added sugar would deplete foam; (2) added shaking would enhance foam. Herein, a simple study is reported as a means of providing preliminary information regarding this question.

METHODS. The standard method for the preparation of a whiskey sour was as follows: All liquids we're measure in a 2oz @oxo measuring cup. 3oz of @canadianclub blended Canadian Whisky, 2oz of @masterofmixes_ Whiskey Sour Mixer, and 3 ice cubes were placed in a Hawkes shaker. The mixture was shaken for 15sec. The liquid was strained out and the ice discarded. The liquid was placed back in the shaker and 1 egg white from a Wellsley farms extra large white grade A egg was added. The mixture was shaken for 30sec and then dumped into a glass. A National brand ruler was used to measure the height of the foam from the foam/drink interface to the crest of the foam. To test the effect of shaking, the second shake was only carried out for 10sec. To test the effect of sugar, a bar spoon of Fee Brother's rock candy syrup was added in the beginning of the procedure. (Pic 1)

RESULTS. The standard method produced foam 0.94in tall (Pic 2). Additional sugar caused the foam to reach a height of 1.13in (Pic 3). Limited shaking reduced the height of the foam to 0.69in (Pic 4)

CONCLUSIONS. The 0.09in  increase of foam from the additional sugar is in contrast to hypothesis 1, and the origin of this observation is currently under study in our laboratory. The 0.25in decrease in foam from the restricted shaking supports hypothesis 2. This is likely caused by less shaking leading to incomplete breakdown of the egg proteins.

It should be noted that the reproducibility of this study was not tested as it is beyond the scope of this investigation.

I'm embracing my inner nerd on this one. I've been watching a Magic: The Gathering-themed Dungeons & Dragons stream lately. In the last episode, our heroes made their way to a nightclub and were served three cocktails. I decided to create them as my own type of fan art. I took a few creative liberties, but tried to stay true to the original suggestions. Here they are, left to right:

Boros Boiler
Add equal parts RumChata, Cinnamon whisky, American Honey whiskey, and honey syrup with ice. Shake. Strain. Layer 100proof cinnamon schnapps in top.

Firemind's Fizz
Blue- 1pt blue Curacao, 1pt triple sec, 1pt simple syrup, 0.5pt peach schnapps
Red- 2pt white rum, 1pt Crème de noyaux, 1pt sloegin
Combine colors separately. Layer.

Selesnya Firmament
2pts gin, 1pt crème de menthe, 1dash absinthe.
Combine with ice. Shake. Strain over crushed ice. Garnish with mint leaves.

Method:

Happy Cinco de Mayo!! As I mentioned, a couple of us are doing a challenge to celebrate. We had to make a margarita that involves an exotic or tropical fruit. For my creation, I used Cucumis metuliferus, or kiwano. Also known as "horned melon" (it's also sometimes called "jelly melon," but that's much less badass). I made a shrub with it. This process extracted the flavors without having to worry about the weird texture of the fruit.

Shrub recipe:
8oz white vinegar
2oz apple balsamic vinegar
2oz @bullyhillvineyards red wine that I left sitting around too long (it's actually really good as a vinegar)
0.5 large horned melon contents
16oz Agave nectar

Add vinegars together and heat to almost boiling. Squeeze the contents of the melon into a jar. Pour vinegar mixture over melon. Seal and let sit for 1-4days. Add agave nectar and mix.

Drink recipe:
2oz Reposado tequila
2oz Horned Shrub
Juice of 1 lime

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with the husk of horned melon on fire!

Disclaimer: Fuego es peligroso 🔥

Here's my entry for the March @homebarawards challenge. The topic: The Big Screen. A movie inspired cocktail. There's no movie that deserves a drink more than 'Citizen Kane'. Called "the most influential movie ever made" and "the #1 movie of all time," nominated for 9 academy awards and winner of Best Original Screenplay (1942), this film has withstood the test of time and still tops lists by USA today and IGN. I couldn't help but use the imagery, inspiration, and innovation to drive my cocktail.
---
The movie:
'Citizen Kane' follows the journey of reporter Jerry Thompson (William Alland) as he tries to uncover the meaning of the final words of newspaper tycoon Charles Foster Kane (Orson Welles). Thompson follows Kane's troubled life from when his family became unexpectedly wealthy, to the building of his newspaper empire, through two marriages and subsequent divorces, to the raising of a castle, all concluding with his lonely final moments as he uttered his last word: "Rosebud." The film paints the portrait of a life corrupted by money, control, and an unsatisfied longing for something else.
---
The drink:
'Rosebud'
1 sugar cube
4-6 rose petals
1 bar spoon of rose syrup
2oz American whiskey 
Muddle sugar cube, rose petals, and rose syrup together. Add whiskey. Add ice and stir. Double strain into a glass over an ice ball (snow-globe) containing a rose.
---
The symbolism:
*The picture is grainy and black and white with dynamic lighting to mirror the film itself.
*The drink is a take-off of an Old Fashioned. The simplicity of the drink represents the simplicity of the life Charles Foster Kane longed for and had ripped away from him. His fortune, art, and prestige never made him content.
*The rose petals and syrup add the floral notes giving the drink its name: 'Rosebud'
*I chose American whiskey because, as the man himself said: "I AM, HAVE BEEN, AND WILL BE ONLY ONE THING - AN AMERICAN."
*The garnish is a rose encased in a "snow-globe." These are the memories Kane yearns so much to have to fill his cold and empty life.

#whiskey #rose #blackandwhite #CitizenKane #homebarawards #mixology #HomeBartender

Do it once, it's novel; do it twice, it's tradition. Here is the second year of Joe's Easter Limoncello. Limoncello is a great spring drink. Its light citrus flavor and bright color are the perfect match for warming weather and brightening sun. Also it's a great thing to bring to Easter dinner with the family.

Preparation:
-Peel 8 lemons. Be careful to get minimal pith (the white part on the back)
-Put peels in a bottle
-Fill bottle with 100 proof vodka (I used @mr.bostonofficial )
-Let sit for forty days and forty nights.
-Flip upside down, for shaking purposes, once a day or so
-Assemble two or more friends
-Add alcohol mixture, simple syrup, and water until desired flavor and consistency is reached
-Cheers!

This week's cocktail is my submission for the contest being held by @liquordotcom for the new "Star Wars" movie. I'm so excited!!!!!!!! Reminscent of the blood crimson blades wielded by the sith, I fashioned my own lightsaber. Hilt

Blade

When your 9yro kid is a picky eater, you make peanut butter and jelly for lunch. When you are a picky drinker, have my 'PB&J Martini' for happy hour! {Please note: @chemistry.cocktails does not approve of feeding 9 year old children martinis for lunch}

Bottom:
Your favorite jelly flavored liqueur (I chose black raspberry schnapps)

Top:
1.5oz cream
1.5oz vodka
2T peanut butter
1T sugar

Add all top ingredients in a shaker and shake. ....like really shake. ...like forget egg white level shaking, you need to shake this baby until your arm falls off and then have your friend help. Add ice and shake again (too much shaking WITH ice will dilute the drink). Pour your jelly layer into your glass, layer on your peanut butter layer.

Here's a cocktail take on a classic snack. The 'chocolate-dipped frozen banana'

Prep: take a banana that's a little past ripe, dice it up, and freeze it. Rim a margarita glass with chopped nuts.

Chocolate layer.
In a blender add...
1/4 of your banana
3/4oz Crème de cocoa
3/4oz cream
1/2 scoop ice cream
Squirt of chocolate Syrup
Blend and pour into the bottom of your glass.

Banana layer.
In a blender add...
1.5oz 99 bananaa
1.5oz milk
1 scoop of ice cream
Blend and layer on top of the chocolate layer.
